of course every citizen has rights! & of course no 1 wants 1 politician to pick & choose. that's why we have congress & why it's made of so many different voices, people, & experiences. we have a ton of members who want to maintain statusquo, time for new voices who want change

all social change starts with an idea and a spark. desegregation, civil rights, lgbtq+ rights, women's rights... if we stifle that spark by saying 'that's not possible' then we've already lost & shot ourselves in the foot.
how so? slavery isn't a 'race issue', it's a historical fact.

i agree it doesn't happen overnight & it takes time, but if we don't actively start working for these policies because they're too big, or 'unrealistic' is shooting ourselves in the foot before we even try. we have big problems & they need big solutions

by ending slavery we gave the country the chance to move forward do better. we acknowledged it was wrong. the fact it didn't end there shows what happens when we keep the same old career politicians in charge rather than allowing for new ideas & a push to live up to our ideals
what about moving everyone onto 1 public insurance plan isn't realistic?
what about it isn't possible?
people back in the 1800's would have said ending slavery was an 'extreme change' but it was one that needed to happen and was for the benefit of our country & the people in it.

i freely admit that i don't know everything & i get things wrong. but one thing i'm sure about is if we don't have 100% coverage & eliminating poverty as our ultimate goal, then we've already failed. our country & planet has reached crunch time. we need out of the box solutions

and that's what's awesome about our country, we can disagree. we all have different ideas about how it should be done & these different voices are what make us strong. we need people who push for extreme changes to get any change in the right direction

i never said this should happen overnight, but it should be our goal. if we really want to be the greatest country on earth then we need to eliminate poverty, homelessness, hunger, & people dying from lack of healthcare coverage.
